meanings.definition: Vamping (verb): playing a simple, repetitive phrase on a musical instrument
meanings.sent1: She enjoys vamping on her guitar during music class.
meanings.sent2: The musician was vamping on the piano at the jazz club.
meanings.sent3: The cat started vamping on the keyboard, creating a unique melody.
meanings.sent4: His fingers danced across the strings, vamping a tune that echoed in the room.
meanings.sent5: The sound of vamping filled the air, captivating everyone in the audience.

meanings.definition: Vamping (noun): the act of playing a simple, repetitive phrase on a musical instrument
meanings.sent1: The vamping added a rhythmic touch to the song.
meanings.sent2: During the performance, the band engaged in lively vamping.
meanings.sent3: The vamping section of the orchestra always brought a smile to the conductor's face.
meanings.sent4: As the night went on, the vamping became the heartbeat of the music.
meanings.sent5: The audience clapped along to the infectious vamping of the musicians.
